dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Education is officially compulsory for eight years, between seven and 15 years of age, and is provided free of charge by the Government. Primary education begins at seven years of age and lasts for four years. Secondary education, beginning at the age of 11, lasts for up to six years, comprising two cycles of three years each. According to estimates by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), enrolment at pre-primary institutions in 2015/16 was equivalent to 39.6% of children (boys 41.8%; girls 37.3%) in the relevant age-group, while enrolment at primary schools in 2017/18 was equivalent to 88.5% of children in the relevant age-group. Secondary enrolment in 2015/16 was equivalent to 53.5% of children in the relevant age-group (boys 64.8%; girls 42.2%). According to UNESCO estimates, in 2023 spending on education represented 7.7% of total budgeted government expenditure.
